title: Watch: 2-YO Baby Girl With Genetic Problem Tries To Cheer Up Her Dad And It's So Heartwarming!
text:
Watch: 2-YO Baby Girl With Genetic Problem Tries To Cheer Up Her Dad And It's So Heartwarming!

Watch: 2-YO Baby Girl With Genetic Problem Tries To Cheer Up Her Dad And It's So Heartwarming!

Video of a 2-year-old girl who has a genetic problem but is trying to cheer up her father, is going viral. Ainsley Gray has osteogenesis imperfecta type 3. This condition makes her bones as fragile as glass. Reportedly, by the age of one she had had close to 100 fractures and 3 brain surgeries.

Her condition is so delicate, that if she is touched the wrong way, her bones might fracture or break. However the little girl keeps on battling with a smile. The family even has a GoFundMe page to help them afford a vehicle.

Now the video of the little girl trying to make her father smile, is going viral.

Father and son cheering-up one another in the hospital.

This is the Twitter content I’m here for...💪😍😏😇🔥🔥 pic.twitter.com/Gze3x1ef7v — Rex Chapman🏇🏼 (@RexChapman) October 29, 2019

In the video, we can see that the little girl, who has pipes going through her body - probably because of her condition - shakes her head and laughs to bring a smile on her father’s face. The video is bound to make you emotional, it is so heartwarming!

Daily Advertiser quoted her mother Ashley Gray as saying, “I want to show people that kids who are different can bring more joy … Ainsley doesn’t know she is different and if she does, she embraces every second … I know God will use her to touch people’s lives. That’s just who he made her to be.”

Don't Miss 1.3 K SHARES 984 SHARES 545 SHARES 109 SHARES

The little girl’s laugh is infectious and she manages to bring a smile on all our faces, not just her father's. More power to her.
description: Video of a 2-year-old girl who has a genetic problem but is trying to cheer her father is going viral. Ainsley Gray has osteogenesis imperfecta type 3. This condition makes her bones as fragile as glass. Reportedly but the age of one she had had close to 100 fractures and 3 brain surgeries. Her condition is so delicate that if she is touched the wrong way, her bones might fracture or break.
